E-mail queries sent to Swiggy and Zomato by PTI seeking responses remained unanswered.

Additionally, the financial sector (30% of Nifty50), is expected to benefit from increased consumption and a potentially more accommodative RBI policy, especially with CPI
Consumer-based sectors are likely to outperform, despite profit-taking seen towards the week's end.

item.title: Trump Family Adds $1.3 Billion of Crypto Wealth in Span of Weeks

bullets: Eric Trump’s stake in American Bitcoin, created in March to mine virtual assets, was worth more than $500 million when the stock surged in
‘Buy Right Now’ World Liberty and American Bitcoin are now operating at the intersection of crypto and public markets.

offered its own mining machinery in exchange for a majority stake in the fledgling firm.

review.headline_rewrite: SEBI may allow MIIs to cut KMP’s variable pay below 25% in weak years
bullets: SEBI is considering letting stock exchanges, clearing corporations and depositories reduce variable incentives for senior management below the 25 per cent floor in poor
“Variable pay is a component of the overall compensation structure, but that does not create an automatic right to receive the minimum payout,” said
The range was introduced in SEBI regulations in 2023, replacing the earlier ceiling of one-third of total pay, based on a slew of recommendations

item.title: Higher interchange fee piques the interest of non-banks to set up white label ATMs

bullets: Last year, Mumbai-based payments technology solution provider Electronic and Payment Services Pvt Ltd (EPS) received a WLAO licence from the RBI.

“We are very intensively looking at it (WLA) as a business case and we believe it’s a very profitable business.

item.title: Vedanta eyes takeover of Jaiprakash Power Ventures

review.headline_rewrite: Vedanta eyes takeover of Jaiprakash Power Ventures
bullets: Mining mogul Anil Agarwal’s Vedanta Ltd is eyeing full control of Jaiprakash Power Ventures Ltd (JPVL), the profit-making power arm of debt-laden Jaiprakash Associates
The metals-to-mining conglomerate is preparing to weigh in on a possible auction for additional stakes in JPVL, in a move that could set the
If its resolution plans go through, the mining moghul’s conglomerate would end up with a 24 per cent stake in Jaiprakash Power.
This would be convertible into equity, roughly 25 per cent stake in the company.
